title: Ashutosh Poudel
text:
PhD Student in Applied Economics, University of Minnesota

 GitHub
 Email
 LinkedIn
 Google Scholar




I am a Ph.D. student in Applied Economics at the University of Minnesota. My primary research interests lie at the intersection of agricultural and food policy analysis. I am also interested in urban and housing economics.
I am a member of the Bellemare Research Group(BeRG) and Minnesota Population Center (MPC) I have also worked with Human Services Data and Analytics Team and Housing Stability Area at the Hennepin County to quantify the extent of doubled-up homelessness.
Prior to my PhD studies, I earned a Master’s degree in Econometrics and Quantitative Economics at the University of Georgia, Athens (Go Dawgs!)

title: Ashutosh Poudel
text:
I am a Ph.D. student in Applied Economics at the University of Minnesota. My primary research interests lie at the intersection of agricultural and food policy analysis. I am also interested in urban and housing economics.
I am a member of the Bellemare Research Group(BeRG) and Minnesota Population Center (MPC) I have also worked with Human Services Data and Analytics Team and Housing Stability Area at the Hennepin County to quantify the extent of doubled-up homelessness.
Prior to my PhD studies, I earned a Master’s degree in Econometrics and Quantitative Economics at the University of Georgia, Athens (Go Dawgs!)

title: Research
text:
My research lies at the intersection of agriculture and food policy, with a particular focus on how these policies influence health outcomes and consumer/retailer responses. Methodologically, I draw on recent advances in econometrics as well as tools from machine learning and AI to provide rigorous empirical insights.
In addition to my primary research, I have a secondary interest in urban and housing economics, where I study the determinants of housing instability and evaluate policy interventions aimed at preventing precariously housed individuals from becoming homeless.
